trans-unit.source: Get Deployment
trans-unit.target: Get Deployment

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Get Deployment</languageKeyword> operation returns configuration information, status, and system properties for a deployment.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Get Deployment</languageKeyword> operation returns configuration information, status, and system properties for a deployment.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Get Deployment</languageKeyword> request can be used to retrieve deployment events for a single deployment slot (staging or production) or for a specific deployment name.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Get Deployment</languageKeyword> request can be used to retrieve deployment events for a single deployment slot (staging or production) or for a specific deployment name.

trans-unit.source: If you want to retrieve information by deployment name, you must first get the unique name for the deployment.
trans-unit.target: If you want to retrieve information by deployment name, you must first get the unique name for the deployment.

trans-unit.source: This unique name is part of the response when you make a request to get the deployment in a deployment slot.
trans-unit.target: This unique name is part of the response when you make a request to get the deployment in a deployment slot.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you have a cloud service deployed to the production environment, you can get the unique name by making a request to <codeInline>…/deploymentslots/production</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you have a cloud service deployed to the production environment, you can get the unique name by making a request to <codeInline>…/deploymentslots/production</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: The response includes a <languageKeyword>Name</languageKeyword> element for the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: The response includes a <languageKeyword>Name</languageKeyword> element for the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: That <languageKeyword>Name</languageKeyword> element value can be used to make a request to <codeInline>…/deployments/%%amp;lt;Name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> if you want to retrieve information about that specific deployment.
trans-unit.target: That <languageKeyword>Name</languageKeyword> element value can be used to make a request to <codeInline>…/deployments/%%amp;lt;Name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> if you want to retrieve information about that specific deployment.

trans-unit.source: To generate the request URI, replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with your subscription ID, <codeInline>%%amp;lt;cloudservice-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of the cloud service, <codeInline>%%amp;lt;deployment-slot%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with <languageKeyword>staging</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>production</languageKeyword>, or <codeInline>%%amp;lt;deployment-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of the deployment.
trans-unit.target: To generate the request URI, replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with your subscription ID, <codeInline>%%amp;lt;cloudservice-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of the cloud service, <codeInline>%%amp;lt;deployment-slot%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with <languageKeyword>staging</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>production</languageKeyword>, or <codeInline>%%amp;lt;deployment-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of the deployment.

trans-unit.source: InternalDnsSuffix
trans-unit.target: InternalDnsSuffix

trans-unit.source: Specifies the domain name suffix for internal name resolution that is automatically assigned by Azure.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the domain name suffix for internal name resolution that is automatically assigned by Azure.

trans-unit.source: All instances of Virtual Machines in a deployment are automatically assigned the domain name suffix.
trans-unit.target: All instances of Virtual Machines in a deployment are automatically assigned the domain name suffix.

trans-unit.source: All instances of web roles or worker roles in a deployment are automatically assigned the domain name suffix when at least one role is assigned a computer name by using the <languageKeyword>vmName</languageKeyword> attribute.
trans-unit.target: All instances of web roles or worker roles in a deployment are automatically assigned the domain name suffix when at least one role is assigned a computer name by using the <languageKeyword>vmName</languageKeyword> attribute.

trans-unit.source: A deployment that is in a VNET with a DNS server configured is not assigned an internal domain name suffix.
trans-unit.target: A deployment that is in a VNET with a DNS server configured is not assigned an internal domain name suffix.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Name Resolution</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/jj156088.aspx#bkmk_IDNS</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Name Resolution</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/jj156088.aspx#bkmk_IDNS</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: InstanceErrorCode
trans-unit.target: InstanceErrorCode

trans-unit.source: The error code of the latest role start.
trans-unit.target: The error code of the latest role start.

trans-unit.source: For Virtual Machines the error codes are:
trans-unit.target: For Virtual Machines the error codes are:

trans-unit.source: WaitTimeout - The role instance did not communicate within 25 minutes.
trans-unit.target: WaitTimeout - The role instance did not communicate within 25 minutes.

trans-unit.source: Typically this indicates that it did not start or that the guest agent is not installed.
trans-unit.target: Typically this indicates that it did not start or that the guest agent is not installed.

trans-unit.source: VhdTooLarge - The VHD image selected was too large for the role instance.
trans-unit.target: VhdTooLarge - The VHD image selected was too large for the role instance.

trans-unit.source: AzureInternalError – An internal error has occurred that has caused to role instance to fail to start.
trans-unit.target: AzureInternalError – An internal error has occurred that has caused to role instance to fail to start.

trans-unit.source: Contact support for additional assistance.
trans-unit.target: Contact support for additional assistance.

trans-unit.source: For web and worker roles this field returns an error code that can be provided to Azure support to assist in resolution of errors.
trans-unit.target: For web and worker roles this field returns an error code that can be provided to Azure support to assist in resolution of errors.

trans-unit.source: Typically this field will be empty.
